title: Jumptech announces new collaboration with ProjectEV
lead: ​ProjectEV has become the latest company to adopt Jumptech’s platform to help ease the installation of electric vehicle (EV) chargepoints.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: SSE unveils Energy Solutions brand as it commits to 100% renewables for business customers
lead: ​All new fixed electricity contracts for SSE business customers will now include 100% renewable electricity as standard.
author: Alice Grundy

title: ScottishPower and Shell team up for large-scale floating offshore wind development
lead: ​ScottishPower and Shell have teamed up to submit proposals for the world’s first large-scale floating offshore windfarms.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Good Energy offers cheaper overnight EV charging with new tariff
lead: ​Good Energy has launched a new electric vehicle (EV) tariff, offering two overnight off-peak periods to charge at a cheaper rate.
author: Alice Grundy

title: 8 Rivers Capital and Sembcorp team up for UK's first AFC power plant
lead: ​Zero Degrees Whitetail Development (ZDW) and Sembcorp Energy UK are to develop the UK’s first NET Power station at the latter’s Wilton International site on Teeside.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: 100MW Minety battery starts trading
lead: ​Europe’s largest battery energy storage system (BESS), the 100MW Minety site, is now fully operation Shell Energy has announced.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: IPPR Environmental Justice Commission calls for £7.5bn scheme to support low carbon heat and transport
lead: ​The IPPR Environmental Justice Commission is calling for the government to introduce a variety of new measures to create a fair transition that puts people at the heart.
author: Alice Grundy

title: British Gas adds EV charging to Hive smart home platform
lead: British Gas is now offering smart electric vehicle (EV) charging through its Hive smart home platform and Alfen chargers.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Government pledges ‘infrastructure will not be a barrier’ in Transport Decarbonisation Plan
lead: ​Charging infrastructure is critical to achieving net zero transport, the Department for Transport (DfT) has said in its Transport Decarbonisation Plan.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Treasury: Removing VAT of green products could ‘impose significant additional pressure’ on finances
lead: ​Despite growing calls from the energy sector and beyond, the Treasury looks set to reject the removal of VAT on green products such as heat pumps and solar.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Good Energy hits back at ‘highly opportunistic’ potential Ecotricity takeover
lead: ​Good Energy has branded Ecotricity’s potential acquisition as a “highly opportunistic approach” following the latter making three indicative offers for the company.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Green Jobs Taskforce issues call to action to create two million green jobs
lead: ​The independent Green Jobs Taskforce has issued a call to action to support the ambition to create two million skilled jobs by 2030.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: New campaign calls for local climate bonds to support green developments
lead: ​A national campaign to help local authorities issue community municipal finance investment for green initiatives has been launched.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Transport Decarbonisation Plan: Government to legislate for home smart charging
lead: ​The long-awaited Transport Decarbonisation Plan is to be published today (14 July), with key focuses being smart charging and phasing out the sale of petrol and diesel heavy goods vehicles (HGVs).
author: Alice Grundy

title: On-street charging is the key to creating a sustainable, green economy
lead: Neil Isaacson, Liberty Charge CEO, examines how to enable on-street charging at scale and how this will help create a green economy.
author: Neil Isaacson

title: Ofgem to consult on DUoS charge timeline in light of RIIO-ED2
lead: ​Ofgem has launched a consultation into temporarily changing the current distribution use of system (DUoS) charge notification periods.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: GenGame to develop home and public EV charging app with simplified payments
lead: ​A Home & Roam charging solution is under development in a collaboration between GenGame, Paua Tech and Evergreen Energy.
author: Alice Grundy

title: UK will fall short of 2050 emissions targets, majority of energy professionals believe
lead: A report has found that 85% of UK energy professionals believe the government will fall short of its 2050 emissions reduction goal.
author: Alice Grundy

title: FES: Britain could reach net zero by 2047 with a ‘coordinated approach’
lead: ​National Grid ESO’s Future Energy Scenarios (FES) 2021 outline four different, credible pathways for the future of energy in Britain, details the transformation of the energy mix and flexibility, the residential sector and the transport sector.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ecotricity eyes Good Energy takeover
lead: ​Ecotricity is to potentially make a bid for Good Energy, having made three indicative offers in the past month.
author: Alice Grundy
